data.title: Yummy Burgers!
data.text: Great variety of unique burgers to choose from.  Turkey and veggie options also available.  Most burgers also available in smaller slider size.  Fries are great!  They also have salads and some fun desserts.

data.title: Good burger, but not as great as advertised
data.text: I work in Ogden so visit this area frequently to grab lunch. I've hit this spot a few times and while the burgers were good, I felt they were a little overpriced and overrated. The one good thing you get here is a wide variety of choices. Also, they pitched a dessert item called a fuzzy peach or something like that. Sounded yummy, but was in fact not good at all. It was a peach fried in batter, but the batter tasted like it had been friend in the same grease as fries/onion rings, etc. It was not at all a combo of flavors. Do not get this item! Go for the variety of burger choices, avoid the dessert and its a good stop.

data.title: Tasty but
data.text: I really wanted to love the place but I didn't. It was about average although I felt the food was overpriced. Our waiter took his time getting to us and getting our drink orders. It wasn't busy when we arrived but apparently there was a table with friends of most the servers. Our waiter didn't write down our order which typically I don't mind but I had my picky eaters with me and of course he didn't get their orders right. I don't blame him as it would have been hard to remember it all. I ordered the 1/3 burgers for the kids and I'm not sure what size they got but we were charged the 1/2 pound price. Plus 38 cents for onions on a burger that we left the cheese, lettuce and tomatoes off. Two burgers that were ordered came out wrong. One was an easy fix as we just scraped the lettuce off but the one were we asked for no cheese had to be sent back. The fries and chips were okay but nothing I would go back for. It wasn't cheap. We paid $71 for two adults and three tweens plus drinks.

data.title: Fabulous Big Burgers
data.text:
We ended up in the backyard patio after strolling around the street fair for a couple of hours.  All of us ordered a burger (my girlfriend and I opted for the 1/3 pound instead of the standard 1/2 pound).  I'm glad we did because they were huge.  Mine came with blue cheese and bacon and a side of sweet potato fries.  It couldn't have been any better.
Great location, wonderful server and the perfect finish for the afternoon.

data.title: Delicious gourmet craft burgers.  RR take note!
data.text: Located in an older part of town, this gem happened to be a short walk from our hotel.  The staff was friendly, courteous, and quite welcoming.  We felt right at home.  Several gourmet style burgers were offered .. nearly 1/2 lb of ground chuck cooked to perfection. Mine had a chipolte catsup, egg, and bacon.  It could not have been better.  And the accompanying home made chips were delicious.  And priced under 10 bucks.  What a deal!  Beats RR anytime.

data.title: Attention to Detail
data.text: Burgers and fries way above average. Tasty and not greasy. Friendly and professional service. Casual, bright and nicely decorated place. A detail that really stood out: we were there during a quiet off-peak hour. A staffer was very repeatedly apologetic for stepping up on a chair near our table in order to meticulously polish ceiling light fixtures, and the bulbs inside the lamps. We'll conclude that a restaurant fastidious to polish the bulb in every ceiling lamp probably has pretty high standards for everything else as well. It certainly seemed that way.

data.title: Local burger joint
data.text: I'm mostly writing this review to correct some of the incorrect information in other reviews.  This is not a chain or fast food, it is an Ogden local original.  They have moved locations and are now on historic 25th Street in a cool old building with interior brick walls. I thought the burgers are fries were great and fairly priced. The beef seemed high quality and the burger were definitely hand-made. Friendly service. They have both indoor seating and a small patio too. Kids are fine. They serve beer and wine, no liquor. Also the picture from Tripadvisor is definitely not this Warrens.

data.title: Very good and everything is made fresh when you order it, but a bit pricey for fast food
data.text: Everything I've ever had at Warren's is excellent considering it's a fast food restaurant. It's a bit more expensive than a McDonald's or a Burger King, but everything is made fresh when you order it. They actually cook a fresh patty when you order a hamburger. To me, it's worth paying a little bit more.

data.title: Very entertaining atmosphere
data.text: Sitting out on the patio is always great. The music takes me back to when i was younger - that was a long time ago - and the french fries are yummers.

data.title: Average food, slow service.
data.text: I had the prohibition burger and my husband had the pastrami burger. We also had the fried pickles as an appetizer.  The pickles were really good, and the burger and fries were good as well. But if your place is all about burgers they should be phenomenal,  it's alot like Red Robin.  Don't think I would make the trip again. Also it took 20 minutes to get our check after we were finished.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Great food for the 3 of us.  You can sit outside our dine in. I ordered the sweet potato fries,  they were good but my family's regular fries I liked better.  Kept the drinks full, loved my burger.

data.title: Great fast food!
data.text: They cook the food fresh and have delicious shakes with many flavors to choose from.  Never a disappointment.

data.title: Peanut butter and Jam Wings!!!! They are to die for!!!
data.text: Great food and great new location on 25th Street. You must try the peanut butter and jam wings, sounds pretty gross, but man are they good! We had a work party there and everyone kept ordering more and more PB&J wings! A great taste Craft Burger has developed, Burgers are great as well with the Managers special creations every week.

data.title: Horrible, Horrible, Horrible
data.text: Let me first state that I was a waitress for 4 years and know a bit about the business. Also I am not a high maintenance person. That being said...Everything was terrible at this place! The staff was not busy (literally saw the servers sitting around). We were not even greeted for 20 minutes after we'd been sat and the server did not return with our drinks until the 46th minute since sitting down. We got our food 1h 12m after having sat down. Really the worst service ever. The food was also NOT GOOD at all! I got the philly steak sandwich and it was not worth the money. We will never go there again. EVER. Gosh. Horrible.

data.title: Brick walls were facinating!
data.text: The food was good and the service too.  It was very busy but they did a good job of getting food out.  We don't recommend the Fried Peach dessert but the burgers were huge!

data.title: Dinner was good for casual dining
data.text: The halibut (not the deep fried halibut) had been recommended but when we asked about it, we were told they stopped offering it some time ago.  The spinach artichoke dip was just okay as was the other food we ordered.  Also, at most restaurants, you can substitute your fries for sweet potato fries for a small up-charge, but you can’t do that here.  You have to order the sweet potato fries as a side in addition to the fries that come with the sandwich.  That would be a lot of fries!  The service was very good.

data.title: Great Casual Dining on 25th Street
data.text: Discovered this place while in town for a ski trip.  Great atmosphere, amazing hamburgers, and pleasantly surprised to see they have a full bar.  Our waitress was friendly and efficient and the manager also stopped by to make sure our expectations were being met.  We will return when we come to Ogden again!

data.title: Great Halibut
data.text: I've enjoyed their halibut sandwich several times as i live about 15 miles from Warren's.  They pride themselves with Quality.  I've enjoyed their fish & chips also.  They have been in business a long time and they certainly know what the customers want.

data.title: Best Steak Burger Ever!!!
data.text:
Their 1/2 IB steak burger is the best I have ever had for a very reasonable price. The shakes are pretty awesome too.
Would recommend you go here for lunch or munchies!

data.title: Hope our experience wasn't normal
data.text: I will start out by saying that we hope what we experienced is because they just opened at their new location. We went to Bistro 258 regularly, and were happy when we read about the new owners of the location were going to keep some of the Bistro's recipes along with the their own Craft Burgers. When we were seated and asked about what we would like to drink, we inquired about the beer. The person told us about what was on tap. We could see a whole cooler with what looked like a pretty good selection in it, but were never offered a beer or wine menu. That was fine, since we chose what was on tap. Good lunch menu...craft burgers, sandwiches and salads. We all chose a different burger, and they were all okay. Asking about the menu, we were told the other sandwiches and wraps were lunch only, and they have dinner entrees (where the Bistro recipes come in....) and the burgers at night. Not sure why they would drop the sandwiches/wraps for the evening. If I go out and don't feel like a full up dinner, or a burger, a sandwich/wrap option would be plus. Service was ok. Not horrible, but not great either. Hope these things are all happening because of the recent move and opening. We will give Craft Burger a try again and hopefully have a better experience.
